Title: Effect of magnesia-to-phosphate ratio on the passivation of mild steel in magnesium potassium phosphate cement
Abstract: © 2020The low pH of magnesium potassium phosphate (MKPC) has raised concerns over its capability to protect reinforcing steel. The passivation of mild steel in MKPC pore solutions was investigated in this study via electrochemical measurements, XPS and Raman spectroscopy. Results show that the passivity of mild steel in MKPC was comparable or even better than that in Portland cement. Although the passivity was dominated by the pH of MKPC, it also increases with increasing magnesium-to-phosphate (M/P) ratios. The formation of iron phosphate in the low pH MKPC (such as M/P 7) also made additional contributions to the passivity of steel.
